title: What is the significance of a magical era in the resurgence of Western tradition?
first_phrase: In this final part of the text, the author reflects on the decline of the Western world due to a lack of impulse to elevate living values to a higher order. The author suggests that a new civilization, free from materialism and spiritualism, will eventually revive the Western tradition. Using the terms "magic" and "magical view of the world," the author proposes that adopting a new form of traditionalism rooted in the ancient Arctic-Atlantic spirit may help the West overcome the age of darkness.
content: E per le relazioni di analogia che un tale stile ha col significato speciale- se- condo cui in questa sede spesso sono stati usati i termini « magia » e « visione magica del mondo », può dirsi: è a mezzo di un'epoca magica che l'Occidente potrà eventual- mente risolvere il nodo della « età oscura » — kali-yuga, età del ferro. last_phrase: In conclusion, it can be said that it is through an era of active and strongly personalized realism, with a transcendental aspect, that the West may eventually resolve the knot of the "Dark Age." The new traditional form that the West can adopt will be derived from its ancient arctic-Atlantic spirit and heroic races. As new paths and boundaries are opened, it is important to remember that these meanings are reaffirmed in the same contact with the supersensible within a magical era.
